conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the back right.
Shadow A is cast by the cylindrical object located to the far right of the scene, short and vertical.
Shadow B is cast by the cake-like object in the center, small and slightly elongated to the right.
Shadow C is cast by the roll with the cross symbol, situated to the bottom left, elongated to the right.
Shadow D is cast by the small ring-like object on the right, short and slightly elongated to the right.
Shadows will shift positions from rightward to leftward when the light source moves to the back right.
Shadows are expected to become larger when the light source moves further away and changes direction.
Shadow A will extend leftward and become longer as the light source moves back right.
Shadow B will shift to extend leftward and increase in length.
Shadow C will change direction to extend leftward and become longer.
Shadow D will shift leftward and become longer.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift directions to extend towards the front left and become larger.
